, regular trains run to Tai'an and take 6 hours while costing ¥56-65 one way. Express trains also run from
and take only 3.5 hours, though the ticket price jumps to ¥148. As of July 2009, express trains only leave from

at 6AM and 10:30AM. Purchasing your train ticket in advance is a must during busy season, unless you don't mind standing in the aisle for the entire trip. Both the regular and express trains pass through

. There is an high speed train from Beijing to Shanghai which stops at Taian High Speed Railway Station.
From the train station, bus number K18 will bring you to
. From there, bus nr 7 will bring you to the Dai Miao Temple (alight

Alternatively, you can also take a bus from Qingdao's Sifang long-distance bus station. The trip takes 6 hours and costs ¥116. Unfortunately, it is virtually impossible to figure out the bus schedule without going to the bus station (there is no number to call and nobody in town seems to be familiar with the schedule), but Sifang is a short cab ride from town (only about ¥12-15 from the train station).

content=A three-star hotel located at the foot of

. Rooms have little character, but they are spacious, reasonably clean, and some have views of the mountain. Plus, each room has free plug-in internet access and a water cooler dispensing drinking water (a nice touch in China!).
